title: nbdev-tutorial
text: This file will become your README and also the index of your documentation.

title: nbdev-tutorial
text:
How to use
In this tutorial we just implemented two functions

say_hello("Siegfried")

'Hello Siegfried!'



say_hello_basque("John")

'Kaixo John!'

title: nbdev-tutorial
text:
That’s it!
Remember to run nbdev_prepare

title: 00 - Intro to nbdev and Gradio
text:
source

say_hello

 say_hello (to)

Say hello to somebody

source


say_hello_basque

 say_hello_basque (to)

Say hello to somebody, in Basque
Let’s add some tests to our functions:

test_eq(say_hello("Fasteno"), "Hello Fasteno!")
test_eq(say_hello_basque("Asier"), "Kaixo Asier!")

Let’s also try adding some graphics to our notebook

display(SVG('<svg height="200" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><circle cx="200" cy="80" r="60"/></svg>'))




That’s it!
